If more than 1000 requests occur within 60 seconds, it indicates an attempt to overwhelm the server, leading to service disruption. Immediate action is needed to mitigate the threat and maintain web service availability.

Description: This alert is triggered when a web-based Denial of Service (DoS) attack is identified. The attack involves overwhelming a web server with excessive traffic or requests, causing disruptions or outages in service. This could be indicative of an attempt to exploit vulnerabilities in the web application or to disrupt the availability of web services.

rule.description: Checkpoint:spray of Suspected outbound C2 traffic detected via UDP port .
rule.info: Description: This alert is triggered when outbound UDP traffic is detected, exhibiting patterns commonly associated with Command and Control (C2) activity, which could indicate an attempt by malware to communicate with an external C2 server.

rule.description: CheckPoint: Multiple RDP inbound connections detected.
rule.info: Description: This alert is triggered when there are multiple RDP inbound traffic attempts from one or more source IP addresses to two distinct destination IP addresses within a 60-second window. The alert indicates potential suspicious activity or scanning behavior, which may suggest an attempt to exploit RDP services.

rule.description: CheckPoint: RDP Outbound Traffic to Multiple Destinations.
rule.info: Description: This alert is triggered when RDP outbound traffic is detected from one or more source IP addresses to two unique destination IP addresses within a 60-second. This pattern could indicate potentially suspicious or unauthorized remote access attempts.

Description: This alert is triggered when multiple port scan attempts are detected on a range of ports from a single source within a short time frame. Vertical port scans involve probing a series of ports on a single IP address, which could indicate a scanning or probing attempt by an attacker to identify open ports and potential vulnerabilities.

Description: This alert is triggered when multiple connection attempts are made across various ports on one or more target hosts, indicating a possible horizontal port scan. Attackers typically use this technique to find open ports on different systems, suggesting reconnaissance activity.
